column4: Ok, I'm back. I've installed Ubuntu from the alternate install CD....still get a blank screen after the splash screen. No response to ctrl-alt-F1. Anyone?
Ok, well, anyone know how I can boot into a command line
did you try booting 'single user mode', or 'recovery'?
hard to say when you can't log at any logs or anything. work on being able to boot to a command line
i'm guessing it might have to do with video mode
press 'e' in the grub menu to edit the boot command line
sweetpi: I don't actually get a grub menu...it pauses for a moment with a cursor, then goes to usplash, then goes blank. pressing "e" does nothing. :/
mm, that sucks. i had this problem with one of my monitors. it still has to do with video mode, i think, but i don't know the solution.
ah, you were able to edit the boot line?
eventually I'll get it figured out...I have video problems on every gateway I've ever tried installing ubuntu on
sweetpi: I was able to boot into recovery and low graphics mode, so now I'm going to go over the logs
sweetpi: Thanks for the help guys. I'll get the rest of it figured out tomorrow, ou got me pretty far though. Again, thanks.
